newsitem.title: GERMANY: Holzmann omits dividend, hints at results.
newsitem.headline: Holzmann omits dividend, hints at results.

text.p: German construction group Philipp Holzmann AG, which passed on paying a dividend in 1995, said it would also omit a dividend for 1996, confirming what company officials had been hinting at for some time.

In a short mandatory bourse statement, the group, which made losses of 443 million marks in 1995 following huge write-downs for losses on real estate projects, said its group results were slightly positive last year.
At the parent company, results show the company broke even, Holzmann said, giving no numbers.
"There will be no dividend," the group added.
The group also said that two board members, Juergen Schoenwasser and Gerhard Loegters, would resign.
